creator: gregw@mortbay.org
text:
On cvs head Sun Aug 11 16:13:33 UTC 2002
The servlet test HttpServletRequestWrapperGetRequestURLTest is looking for
a parameter "server", but the test client sends the parameter "Server".

creator: Ryan.Lubke@Sun.COM
text:
Looking at the HEAD branch, I don't see an issue.  The client sends a
request-header of 'server', not 'Server'.

Did you run into this issue in a CVS workspace, a nightly build, or the 4.0.0
test build?

creator: Ryan.Lubke@Sun.COM
text: As I've received no response, I'm going to close this out.

creator: gregw@mortbay.org
text:
Sorry I did not respond.  I'm running from CVS head.
Here is the request that I received from watchdog:

GET /servlet-tests/hsreqw/HttpServletRequestWrapperGetRequestURLTest HTTP/1.0
servletpath: _servlet-tests_hsreqw_HttpServletRequestWrapperGetRequestURLTest
Host: localhost:8080
Server: localhost
prefix: http
port: 8080


But I just worked out what the problem is!  Jetty caches common headers, so that
it does not need create new strings for them all the time.  The cached version
that Jetty is creating is "Server" rather than "server".

As HTTP headers are case insensitive and proxies are entitled to rewrite headers
, the I think that this test should do equalsIgnoreCase rather than just equals.

Sorry for the miss-diagnosis.
